examples.translation: I rubbed my wrists with cologne.

etymology: From Proto-Turkic *ob- (“to crush, mince, grind”). Cognate with Old Turkic [script needed] (uv-, “to crumble, pulverize”), Azerbaijani ovmaq (“to crumble, massage”), Bashkir ыуыу (ıwıw, “to grind, pound”), Southern Altai ӱйер (üyer, “to rub”).
